_PAGE_FILTER_JSON_ARGUMENTS_VALUE_: The value or JavaScript object to be converted into a JSON string
_PAGE_FILTER_JSON_ARGUMENTS_REPLACER_: A function that affects the behavior of the conversion process, or an array of strings and numbers that specifies properties of value to be included in the output. If replacer is an array, all elements in this array that are not strings or numbers (neither primitive values nor wrapper objects), including symbol values, are completely ignored. If replacer is anything other than a function or an array (e.g., null or not specified), all string-based properties of the object are included in the resulting JSON string
_PAGE_FILTER_JSON_ARGUMENTS_SPACE_: A string or number used for inserting white space (including indentation, newline characters, etc.) into the output JSON string for readability purposes. If this is a number, it indicates the number of spaces or other characters to be used as indentation, limited to a maximum of 10 (i.e., any number greater than 10 is treated as though it were 10). Values less than 1 indicate that no white space should be used. If this is a string, the string (or the first 10 characters of the string if it's longer than that) is inserted before each nested object or array. If space is anything other than a string or number (can be either a primitive or a wrapper object) — e.g., null or not specified — no white space is used
_PAGE_FILTER_JSON_DESCRIPTION_: The function filterJson converts a JavaScript object or value into a formatted JSON string. It allows customization of the replacer (function to alter the behavior of the conversion) and indentation (number of spaces or other characters for indentation).
